29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

386840.name: Lost Echo of the Shared Wish
386840.lore:
THEY alone played the supreme rhythm until it was downed in THEIR multiple choruses.
Yet, THEIR listeners refused to fall silent. As the foolish dreamer seized the string of the shared wish, the false player repeated the music forgotten by the world.

"Stars trace your fingers and command all living's law and authority... Sweet dreams nowadays have manifested, and the gazillions of old laws have all faded away."
comeFrom: Echo of War: Penacony Grand Theater

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

589819.name: Celestial Section
589819.desc: Melodious section fallen from the heavens. Used to level up Traces moderately for Harmony characters.
589819.lore:
A musical section scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the heavens, it blends into the cacophony, like grains of sand scattered in the desert.

"No one notices it until it ignites a spark of inspiration..."

673760.name: Heavenly Melody
673760.desc: Symphonic movements from the cosmos. Used to level up Traces significantly for Harmony characters.
673760.lore:
A piece of music scattered from order. It quietly echoes from beyond the heavens, drowned out by profound silence, like a lone star twinkling in a river of stars.

"No one feels it until it is forgotten by all ♬..."

874346.name: Firmament Note
874346.desc: Scattered note from the firmament. Used to level up Traces slightly for Harmony characters.
874346.lore:
A musical note scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the clouds, it blends into the symphony of mortal sounds, like a tear dissolving into the sea.

"No one hears it until it dissolves into a song..."

6103825.name: Darkveil Moonlight
6103825.desc: An alien crown left behind by the Moonlit Pegasus. Can be used for Ascension of Quantum characters.
6103825.lore:
In a legend veiled by night, Oronyx once purloined the sun's radiance to bestow it upon the moon, as the Pegasi bore the brimming moonlight to ensure the earth's luminance during the slumber of Aquila.

"How can the moon's pallid glow rival the splendor of the sun?"
comeFrom: Stagnant Shadow: "Murmuring Woods" Grove of Epiphany

20170864.name: Courage-Torn Chest
20170864.desc: A fragment of the Strife Titankins after their demise. Normal material used for enhancement.
20170864.lore:
The slothful generals began to drill, and the reclusive sages began to plot. Then humanity discovered they could shatter the creations of gods, and slaughter became war.

"Fear is the chisel of courage."
comeFrom: Titankin at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Crepuscular Beasts at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

20389475.name: Glory-Aspersed Torso
20389475.desc: The heart of a Strife Titankin, full of divine power. Advanced material used for enhancement.
20389475.lore:
In the beginning, humanity fought wars to stay alive, but now some fight as fearlessly as the Titankins of Strife to achieve death. The Kremnoans say that perhaps warriors of flesh and stone share the same heart —

"And this heart is called glory, with courage flowing within."
comeFrom: Titankin at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Crepuscular Beasts at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

20445700.name: Fear-Stomped Flesh
20445700.desc: Dust that forms the Strife Titankins. Crude material used for enhancement.
20445700.lore:
The tide of death sweeps across the world, and giants of hatred and resentment step forth from the River of Souls. All fear and cower before that stone-carved legion.

"Slaughter is the stone from which fear is hewn."

ranks.name: Rite of Sugar Scoop
ranks.descHash: While the Zone lasts and after ally targets attack enemies, additionally deals <u>True DMG</u> equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the total DMG of this attack to targets that have been dealt <u>Additional DMG</u> by the Zone.

ranks.name: Guide of Dream Tour
ranks.descHash: The <u>Additional DMG</u> dealt by the Zone increases to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the original DMG. When the Zone deals <u>Additional DMG</u>, further deals <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> instance(s) of Additional DMG.

ranks.name: Trove of Morning Glow
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Peace of Empathy Bond
ranks.descHash: While "Numinosity" lasts, the DMG dealt by all allies ignores <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the target's DEF.

ranks.name: Clock of Wonder Origin
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Morrow of Star Shine
ranks.descHash: After Tribbie uses Ultimate, launches her Talent's <u>Follow-up ATK</u> against all enemies. The DMG dealt by Talent's <u>Follow-up ATK</u> increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

skills.descHash: Deals Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Tribbie's Max HP to one designated enemy. Deals Quantum DMG equal to #2[i]% of Tribbie's Max HP to adjacent targets.
skills.name: Hundred Rockets

skills.descHash: Gains "Numinosity," lasting for #2[i] turn(s). This duration decreases by 1 at the start of this unit's every turn. While Tribbie has "Numinosity," increases all ally targets' All-Type RES PEN by #1[f1]%.
skills.name: Where'd the Gifts Go

skills.descHash:
Activates a Zone and deals Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Tribbie's Max HP to all enemies.
While the Zone lasts, increases enemy targets' DMG taken by #2[f1]%. After an ally target attacks, for every 1 target hit, deals 1 instance of Quantum Additional DMG equal to #3[f1]% of Tribbie's Max HP to the target that has the highest HP among the hit targets.
The Zone lasts for #4[i] turn(s). This duration decreases by 1 at the start of this unit's every turn.
skills.name: Guess Who Lives Here

skills.descHash: After other ally characters use Ultimate, Tribbie launches Follow-up ATK, dealing Quantum DMG equal to #1[f1]% of Tribbie's Max HP to all enemies. This effect triggers up to 1 time per character. When Tribbie uses Ultimate, resets the trigger count for other ally characters. If the target was defeated before the Follow-up ATK is launched, then launches the Follow-up ATK against new enemy targets entering the battlefield.
skills.name: Busy as Tribbie

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and after the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash: After using Technique and upon entering battle, obtains "Numinosity," lasting for <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> turn(s).
skills.name: If You're Happy and You Know It

embedBonusSkill.descHash: After using Talent's <u>Follow-up ATK</u>, increases the DMG dealt by Tribbie by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>. This effect can stack up to <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> time(s), lasting for <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> turn(s).
embedBonusSkill.name: Lamb Outside the Wall...

embedBonusSkill.descHash: While the Zone lasts, Tribbie's Max HP increases by an amount equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of the sum of all ally characters' Max HP.
embedBonusSkill.name: Glass Ball with Wings!

embedBonusSkill.descHash: At the start of battle, Tribbie regenerates <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Energy. After other ally targets attack, Tribbie regenerates <nobr>#2[f1]</nobr> Energy for each target hit.
embedBonusSkill.name: Pebble at Crossroads?

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: We are Tribbie — the "messenger" delivering prophecies~
Trianne: We are Trianne — the "gatekeeper" traversing a hundred worlds!
Trinnon: We are Trinnon — the "priest" listening to the prophecy of the gods.
Tribbie, Trinnon, and Trianne: We are Tribios — the "Holy Maiden of Janusopolis." Please join us on our journey to the end of the west wind, where fresh flowers bloom.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: Good morning, afternoon, evening~
Trinnon: Good sunny days, rainy days, snowy days.
Trianne: Good head, good legs, good body!
Tribbie, Trinnon, and Trianne: —Everything's good everywhere!

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: Trailblazer, see you tomorrow.
Trinnon: If we don't see you tomorrow, then...
Trianne: We'll see you the day after tomorrow!

voiceItems.title: About Self: Identity
voiceItems.text: Like dandelions scattering their seeds, the moon reflecting in a lake, or the sea turning into raindrops, once we pass through the Gate of Infinity, we can visit even more city-states in a limited amount of time!

voiceItems.title: About Self: Empathy
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: Whenever we play guessing games, before I can even finish reading the question, Trianne and Trinnon have already blurted out the answers.
Trianne: Whenever the wind blows strong, before I can even open my eyes, Tribbie and Trinnon have already started spinning on the spot!
Trinnon: Whenever I eat a sour apple, before I can even stick out my tongue, Tribbie and Trianne are already yelling that it's too sour.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Rocket
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: To prevent our journey from being disrupted—
Trinnon: To maintain peace on our journey—
Trianne: We ride on a rocket, traversing Amphoreus!
Tribbie: Tribbie sends warmth~
Trianne: Trianne beats the baddies!
Trinnon: Trinnon...
Tribbie: Yeah, that's how it is!

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: We love playing "Guess Who We Are" with everyone~ I am Trinnon! I am Trianne~ I am Tribbie. How many did you guess correctly?

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: We once had long hair, just like our mother. Back then, there were many of us. Some had long braids, some had high ponytails... But now our hair is getting shorter, almost too short to tie up.

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: We once had a dream. In the dream, we borrowed the moon from gentle Sister Night, the wind from kind Uncle Earth, and used colorful stars as sails. Then we floated and drifted on the west wind to a small island full of flowers.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: The Flame-Chase Journey has been going on for a long time. I still remember what mother said: We are merely the conduits of the prophecy. Without the efforts of countless heroes and citizens, the prophecy will never be realized!

voiceItems.title: About Aglaea
voiceItems.text: Agy... She's not as cold as she seems on the surface. Look, our clothes were sewn by Agy! But her passion and attention must mostly be focused on her ideals of genesis, leaving little left for other things.

voiceItems.title: About Phainon
voiceItems.text: Snowy... It always feels like he's carrying too much. Not just his own wishes but also the hatred and expectations of others... Though we all have our own missions, I still get worried... Bearing everything alone is not a good habit.

voiceItems.title: About Mydei
voiceItems.text: Anyone who thinks De only knows how to fight is greatly mistaken! In terms of strength, he's number one. In terms of military strategy and history, he's also number one! I'm really good at teaching people!

voiceItems.title: About Castorice
voiceItems.text: Cas is always alone — when she's lost or sad or even when she's happy. We want to hug her and tell her it's okay. But no matter how close we get, she always feels so far away...

voiceItems.title: About Anaxa
voiceItems.text: Naxy talks about so much weird stuff every time I see him. His words make my head spin... But if he doesn't talk like that, then it kinda feels odd...

voiceItems.title: About Hyacine
voiceItems.text: Cinny has always helped us against our deterioration, and it's not just her medicines that work wonders. We get super re-energized every time we see her smiles that are as warm as sunshine!

voiceItems.title: About Cipher
voiceItems.text: Ciphy always said that she hates rules and restraints, but we've always known that she's a good kid. She'd cry for us, and she would help people without a second thought... She may never admit it, but the weight of the Flame-Chase Journey never left her mind...

voiceItems.title: About Hysilens
voiceItems.text: Big Sis Hysilens often hummed songs of the sea for us, keeping us company through the lonely days. When we miss her, we'd go listen to the conch she left behind...

voiceItems.title: About Cerydra
voiceItems.text: The Imperator's speeches might sound extreme to most Amphoreans, but we saw how she spent days on end staring at the chessboard, neither eating nor drinking, lost in thought over the road ahead. It's those quiet moments unseen by the world that made us choose to stay...

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: The whispers of the soul shatter into thousands of pieces and fly away.

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: Look, we've already come so far!

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: Push open the door. A new world lies beyond!

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: With us here, you'll never get lost.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Tribbie promises you that everything will be fine~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Aglaea
voiceItems.text: We're running out of time, Agy. Let's hurry!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Mydei
voiceItems.text: De, are you going for a quick victory this time too? I'll do my best to support!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Castorice
voiceItems.text: Don't worry, Little Cas, Tribbie is pretty amazing!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Anaxa
voiceItems.text: Stop saying weird things!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Hyacine
voiceItems.text: If we get into a tight spot, we'll need Cinny's help~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Cipher
voiceItems.text: Don't worry about big sister Tribbie, Ciphy. We will definitely catch up to you!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Phainon
voiceItems.text: Snowy, don't push yourself too hard if you're feeling tired~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Hysilens
voiceItems.text: Hehe, now we get to hear good music!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Cerydra
voiceItems.text: Advance. The prophecy will guide the Flame-Chase campaign.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: Move aside, no bullying allowed!

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: Don't be afraid... I'm not afraid...

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: Underestimating us will cost you.

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: Watch my moves closely.

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: You clap one, I clap one. You clap two, I clap two. You clap three, I clap three. You clap four, I clap four. You clap five, I clap five. You clap six, I clap six. You clap seven, I clap seven. You clap eight, I clap eight. You clap nine, I clap nine. You clap ten, I clap ten. Wh—When will this end!?

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: Cover your ears~

voiceItems.title: Skill 1
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: Huge news~
Trinnon: Hehe.

voiceItems.title: Skill 2
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: Delivering warmth~
Trinnon: Hum.

voiceItems.title: Follow-up ATK 1
voiceItems.text:
Trianne: CHAAAARGE—!
Tribbie: BANG!

voiceItems.title: Follow-up ATK 2
voiceItems.text:
Trianne: Away— And take-off together!
Tribbie: Good!

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: Big meanie!

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: Super big meanie!

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate 1
voiceItems.text: Tribbie: Is it coming?

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate 2
voiceItems.text: Trianne: It's co-ming!

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate 3
voiceItems.text: Trinnon: It's coming...

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text:
Tribbie: Ready, set—
Tribbie, Trianne, & Trinnon: Riding the west wind, away we go~

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: See you... tomorrow...

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: Wonderful, we meet again.

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: We like you!

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: There's strength in numbers~

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: Toward tomorrow, onward!

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: Twinkle, twinkle, little star~

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: One, two... not enough for us to share.

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: This one's for Tribbie, this one's for Trianne, and this one's for Trinnon~

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: Here's a thumbs-up for you~

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: A round of applause for you! Good job!

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: Who can help us with this big guy...

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: Share the good news with the whole city!

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
From that holy land blessed by the tripartite prophecy, the messenger split into a thousand forms, embarking on a long journey.
Tribios, Holy Maiden of Janusopolis, the Chrysos Heir who stole Passage's Coreflame, toiled for the masses and brought the news of deliverance to all domains.
—Seek the children of humanity with golden blood in their veins, shatter the dimmest dark in this world, and walk toward the tomorrow where the stars gleam.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
"Date: ▇▇▇ / ▇▇
It's been ten years since we fled Janusopolis.
In those ten years, we measured the earth with our steps, unknowingly covering every corner of Amphoreus.

The spread of the black tide has been far worse than expected. From west to east, from south to north, even cities high in the sky have not been spared... We watched as tiny nations were consumed overnight by the growing black tide, turning all life into its fuel, surging forward with even greater force... The once-glorious past of Amphoreus is gone, replaced by overwhelming decay, raging Titans, fallen heroes, and displaced people.

But those consumed by the Strife fail to see.

The black tide has drawn near the inland cities. These cities are rich and well-connected, thriving on trade, but some dismissed our prophecy as nonsense and saw us as mere priests of bad omens, with no one listening, no one caring... If it takes shedding blood to unite the people, why not let it start with us?

Tri▇▇▇▇, I know you went to the front lines to send word of the black tide's advance, only to be struck down by the arrows of Black Tide Creatures.
Tri▇▇▇▇, I know you helped the refugees escape, only to be despised by the nobility and left to die by an assassin's dagger.
Tri▇▇▇▇, I know you escorted lost children, so close to safety. Your bright braids are now soaked in blood, and we can no longer braid or care for them.

With the fall of one city after another, the people are beginning to look beyond their endless conflicts and see the world on the brink of collapse.

The blood of the innocent will not be shed in vain. We've walked the first steps through thorns, hoping those who follow us will go farther than we ever could..."

— An ancient diary entry
The paper as thin as a cicada's wings, left in the arms of a doll by Trianne

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
"Date: ▇▇▇ / ▇▇
'Holy Maiden, we are ready to listen. Guide us through these end times and pray for our victory in battle,' said the kings.

The kings restored the identity of the Holy Maiden of Janus to us, placed us on an altar, dressed us in silk, and concealed our faces with ceremony.
Yet, we did not return to the city but lived in the castle. We wished to pray for the sick farmers and wandering warriors, to ease the sorrow of the grieving, to guide the lost, to bless the newly-weds, and to watch them sing around the bonfire.

Yet, just as it was in Janusopolis, the kings were unwilling to see us mingle with the people...

Mother, at this moment, we truly understand your helplessness and despair back then. We once believed that the prophecy would compel the kings to set aside their grievances and unite in search of the Chrysos Heirs, offering a glimmer of hope for salvation. Yet, they fear those with golden blood might strip them of their power. What they desire are wars waged in the name of prophecy. The hard-earned trust and the expectant gazes of the people are gradually being eroded.
The Coreflame of Janus burns ever hotter, and the golden prophecy continues to scrutinize us, urging us onward.

We decided to flee.

Tri▇▇▇▇ and Trianne opened the Century Gate, planning to meet in the dense forest, but encountered a rain of poisoned arrows. Trianne dodged a disaster but was unfortunately taken hostage by soldiers, becoming increasingly distant from us.
Tri▇▇▇▇ chose to charge at the enemy's spear, clinging to the soldier who tried to withdraw his weapon, but we underestimated the king's cruelty. Even in death, we could not be claimed by other city-states.
...
The pain inflicted was many times greater than usual. This spring, most of us remain forever in the wilds where flowers have yet to bloom.

Goodbye, Tri▇▇▇▇.
Goodbye, Tri▇▇▇▇.
Goodbye, Tri▇▇▇▇.
...
Trianne, we are not yet ready to say goodbye to you. Please be sure to find us again...

Tonight, we will be able to cross this wilderness."

— A diary entry kept by Trinnon
Illustrated with a meteor crossing the sky

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
"Date: ▇▇▇ / ▇▇
The first time we met Agy, she told us she was fond of the name Tribios, praising it as noble and beautiful, much like the garments she crafted. We asked if that was her sole reason for keeping us around. She shook her head, explaining she mainly wanted to hear this teacher's nightly tales.

Agy was also just a girl back then, afraid of the dark and ghosts. Remembering how her cravings led us on stealthy trips to the kitchen for leftover bread at night always brings a smile to our faces. Time is a sculptor, and having shaped Cerydra and Hysilens, now it has rendered Agy beautifully.

Agy never lets anyone down, just as we've always taught her. Her golden threads weave a dense net, ensnaring any foe that dares come close to her fingertips.

Yet the Cleaners who dwell in the shadows ambushed our team on the return journey. The assassins loyal to the Council of Elders would never allow the growth of Chrysos Heir who could lead the holy city of Okhema. We are no different. We, too, would rather sacrifice ourselves rather than stand by and look on as the young heroes' lives were cut short —

We managed to escape the ordeal using the Century Gate, though our consciousness grew hazy by one more portion... After the last passage through the Century Gate, I feared we'd never find Trinnon and Tribbie again...

Don't worry, Agy. It's not our time yet. We just need a brief rest, and we'll be back on our feet...
But we must hasten our steps now..."

— A diary with weaker and weaker handwriting
Reminisced by Trianne, recorded by Trinnon, and finalized by Tribbie

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"Date: ▇▇▇ / ▇▇
The dreams are fading...Hyacine said it's because there's less and less we can remember.
But today, we dreamed of countless paths stretching into the darkness. The sky was pitch black, and we kept running and running, but no matter how far we went, we couldn't find a way out...

'Don't be afraid. The brvae is here!' The supremely mighty Snowy descended from the sky, driving away the monsters for us.
'Teacher, fly forward!' The tiny purple Cas flapped her wings, blowing away the stones ahead.
'Bang Bang!' The strong gray raccoon struck with great force!
'Hmph—' The red lion devoured the villains!

Our reliable new companions! They took the torches from those who came before, each one lighting up the darkness in turn.
But the torchlight in our hands is dying down — we need to hurry forward!

— With this thought, our bodies began to grow, becoming so big that we could touch the sky without even lifting our hands. Our toes sank into the vast blue sea, while green leaves sporuted from our fingertips. Trianne's voice became the sound of rushing wind, carrying distant sands, and Trinnon rested upon soft, snow-capped mountains, ears filled with the lullaby of wind and rain.

And so we walked and walked, and soon there was only one path left before us —
Ahead, the sky turned rosy, the ground silver-white. The west wind blew, and the fields were in full bloom. Wait... this place feels familiar. Is this Amphoreus? The roadside springs tasted of hoeny and milk, and the trees were heavy with endless fruit. As we walked on, the moon and stars climbed the sky — that was Tri▇ gliding among them! Ahead of us was also Tri▇, Tri▇, Tri▇... It turns out everyone was waiting for us at the destination!

Look, there in the distance, Mother is greeting us! She's waving, smiling at us!

Shall we go?
Hmm, one day we will come!
But our journey isn't over yet!
So, see you tomorrow?
We will meet 'tomorrow'!
Yes, see you tomorrow."
— A diary filled with crooked handwriting and misspellings

name: Tribbie
descHash: From that holy land blessed by the tripartite prophecy, the messenger split into a thousand forms, embarking on a long journey. Tribios, Holy Maiden of Janusopolis, the Chrysos Heir who stole Passage's Coreflame, toiled for the masses and brought the news of deliverance to all domains. —Seek the children of humanity with golden blood in their veins, shatter the dimmest dark in this world, and walk toward the tomorrow where the stars gleam.
